DOC.brief_summary: In chronic kidney disease calcium (Ca) and phosphate (P) metabolism disorders are very common and also they are one of the leading causes of morbidity in these population. FGF23 is a novel factor that contributes Ca-P disorders. It has been hypothesized that FGF 23 increase is mediated by asymmetric dimethylarginine (ADMA). The aim of the study is to evaluate this hypothesis.
DOC.brief_title: The Role of FGF23 and Asymmetric Dimethylarginine (ADMA) in Chronic Kidney Disease
DOC.criteria: between ages of 18 65 years old chronic kidney disease of stage 24 presence of diabetes mellitus or ischemic hearth disease taking vitamin d therapy
